p: Lipophilic constituents are known to exhibit topical anti-inflammatory activity (Maria et al., 2007 ▶) by enhancing the permeability of the skin to anti-inflammatory drugs and even when in combination (Okoye et al., 2010 ▶). The ability of the n-hexane and dichloromethane fractions in inhibiting topical oedema, may also in part, be due to its lipophilic nature (Ajaghaku et al., 2013 ▶).
